column5: Went out and did a wee bit O fishin' at the old lake today. All was going well until a giant gator ripped my dead stick out of the rod holder where it flew through the air with the greatest of ease and down the hole it went.  Guess I have to build another.  Here's a couple of pics from the day.  My little setup    The big one of the day that didn't pilfer my expensive gear!!!!
Beauty Dave!  Love the beardsicles too!!!
Well if you had to lose a reel I guess that's as good a way as any.
Nice Dave,looks like your fishing at the edge of the shore?,must be one heck of a drop off there.
Davey, it's a mid lake island. The depth where I am is 12'-15'.

Well if you had to lose a reel I guess that's as good a way as any.  Luckily it was not my 6001 it was a 5501 which I have a couple of. Would have liked to see the fish though as the line was peeling off the reel like it was hooked to the back of an 18 wheeler!!!
Those gators are sneaky eh? I too would like to see that fish! At least you still got something
It's a good fish story regardless, and nice pike in the picture.  What was the temperature and how much ice up there?

It's a good fish story regardless, and nice pike in the picture.  What was the temperature and how much ice up there?  Temp was -25C with -35C windchill. Ice thickness was 30"-36". We're low on snow this year. The sled trails are not good with pieces of granite sticking out all over the place. Snow on the lake was less than a foot.
Donchya hate when that happens? I lost two set ups in one day once!! Down the same hole to boot! Lol  Nice gator!  S.
Donchya hate when that happens? I lost two set ups in one day once!! Down the same hole to boot! Lol  Nice gator!  S.  The part that really bugs me Is the reel was a 35 year old ABU made in Sweden.
Too bad about the reel.  Nice pike.  Beautiful scenery.
